content.text: 2025 was a big year full of change and adventure for Kirk and Jessica. The biggest change was their move to Delaware from Houston, where they’re excited to start a new chapter! At work at the Boston Globe, Kirk was fortunate enough to head the development for and launch several large interactive news projects, and has been working on some apps as passion projects. He got back into running (slowly), and released his first solo album on Spotify, which was his goal to release before he turned 30!

2025 was a year that felt so far in the future but has flown by and was full of new adventures. Jessica started the year working in a clinic in Malawi and going on a safari in Kenya with Kirk! Jessica graduated from residency this year, completing her many years of medical training. She said goodbye to many friends in Houston but has also reunited with friends and family now that she’s returned to the East Coast. After lots of studying and some time off, she is now officially double-board certified in both Internal Medicine and Pediatrics and started her dream job as a teaching attending and primary care physician for both adults and children at ChristianaCare in Wilmington, Delaware!

content.description: Jessica went on an away rotation to a Baylor International Pediatric AIDS Initative (BIPAI) clinic in Malawi (while USAID lost its funding), and traveled to Lake Malawi where to successfully avoided getting schistosoma.
After Jessica finished her month in Malawi, Kirk flew to meet her in Kenya where they went on a safari and visited Kirk's cousin Kara in Nairobi.

Kirk and Jessica celebrated their fifth anniversary with a weekend getaway to Corpus Christi and South Padre Island. The trip included a stay at a Best Western for Kirk's first Texas-shaped waffle! Kirk may have called upwards of six Best Westerns to find one that would guarantee the experience.

content.location: Road trip from Houston to PA
content.description: In order to move back to the East Coast, Kirk and Jessica traveled through Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, South Carolina and Maryland. They had many fun stops including this Hawaiian-themed Chick-fil-a called Truett's Luau in Fayetteville, GA!

Kirk surprised Jessica with a trip to Disney World 10 years after she worked there as a college student. Kirk found every possible way to make the fireworks each night special — from the rooftop of The Contemporary, and on Main Street on the Fourth of July/Jessica's birthday, the new Epcot fireworks show while eating dinner at Monsiuer Paul's, and from their room at the Wilderness Lodge!
The Hsieh family (Kirk's mom's side) had a big reunion in the Berkshires where they got to catch up with cousins, aunts and uncles from far away, and enjoy the outdoors together as a big family.

To celebrate Jessica finishing both her boards, they took a trip to Shenandoah to hike and see some friends back in Virginia. They couldn't pass up the opportunity to stop at the northernmost Buc-ee's on the way back.
Kirk and Jessica might be in Thailand as you read this—they're going to attend the wedding of one of Jessica's residency friends!
A beautiful and very filling dish at one of their favorite restaurants in Houston.
They just picked this up from the grocery store out of curiosity and now they can't go back to what they were used to!
They were surprised to discover stunningly authentic Chinese food in Nairobi, thanks to the large population of Chinese workers in the area. The beef noodle soup here was killer.
Though it was just a side dish at this Houston KBBQ restaurant, the scallion salad stole the show.
It seemed like such a simple no-brainer combination. And once Kirk and Jessica sampled this, they started making it all the time at home.
Jessica took Kirk out to his first omakase experience for his 30th birthday, and this was his favorite dish. It was seared over Japanese charcoal and dipped in a citrusy vinaigrette.
It's been Kirk's dream for years to serve pasta in a big parmesan cheese wheel. He finally got to live his dream this year and served cacio e pepe at his 30th birthday party.

This was a short stop in Corpus Christi on their anniversary trip, and their expectations were low. They were blown away by the quality of the meat, the sweet, salty and sour flavors, and the quantity!
Kirk and Jessica's friends Allison and Keegan got married at the Little Pearl in DC, and they served the best wedding food Kirk and Jessica have ever tasted. This was their favorite dish.
Before leaving Texas, Kirk was informed he needed to try Taste of Texas. It was the best steakhouse he'd been to. Also the salad bar is crazy.

content.dish_name: our last food crawl (Tao Roll, shenjian bao, Grapefruit green tea)
content.description: During their last week in Houston, they visited all of their greatest hits in Chinatown. It was bittersweet saying goodbye, but also delicious.
This matcha popup in Houston had a long line but it was worth the way. While usually not a matcha fan, Kirk loved these lattes.
Kirk surprised Jessica during their time at EPCOT with a dinner at Monsieur Paul's. This saffron soup was the star of the show.
Since this is Kirk's favorite restaurant in Philly, it only made sense to go straight there once they moved back to the East Coast.
Kirk got to catch up with Chris, his best man, in NJ. Having pizza of this quality reminded Kirk that he was back home.
Kirk and Jessica celebrated her new job at Bardea Food & Drink in Delaware. This was a family favorite!
It's long been Jessica's dream to be a part of a community supported agriculture program, and the farm down the road has a great one!
This song got Jessica through her commutes to the hospital. It's upbeat and fun, meaning Jessica stays awake!
While searching for the right artist name to release Kirk’s music under, we came across this song. It was actually a bop.

This is Jessica’s favorite song on Kirk’s album! Kirk showed her the demo for this song when they reunited after a month apart that he had written about their lives and she found herself crying in the back of an Uber in Kenya.
Kirk loves Jon Guerra’s songwriting and thinks Jon made an often-repeated passage feel brand new and deeply personal.
This bop pushed Jessica through her last two weeks of boards studying. She's had a Taylor Swift dance party for every standardized test she's taken!
Kirk hit the big 3-0 this year! They celebrated with a party at their house with friends, complete with a parmesan wheel cacio e pepe station.

Jessica completed her final year of medical training and graduated from Med-Peds residency at Baylor College of Medicine. She loved her time as chief resident, and will miss her co-residents and patients.
It was bittersweet to say goodbye to all their friends in Houston, including their small group and co-residents. They left the house was just like they found it, but it was filled with memories.
We bought and moved into a new home in Delaware! Text us if you need our new address.
Jessica started her dream job as an academic Med-Peds primary care physician at ChristianaCare in Wilmington, Delaware, where she cares for both adults and children and teaches the residents.
After a summer of full-time studying, Jessica passed both her Internal Medicine and Pediatrics boards, making her a double-board certified physician!
